title: Lyft’s Stock May Remain Stalled for a While, Analyst Says
text:
Lyft stock is worth half its peak price during the ride-hailing company’s much-hyped initial public offering. A Morgan Stanley analyst doesn’t see that changing anytime soon.

The back story. Lyft led a parade of tech unicorns, private companies valued at more than $1 billion, that sought to go public this year. Despite bullish expectations from many on Wall Street, the stock (ticker: LYFT) is down more than 50% from its day-one peaks, while shares of rival Uber Technologies (UBER) have struggled similarly.

...
description: Lyft, which is focused on North America, needs to take market share from Uber, which has global scale, a Morgan Stanley analyst says.
